title: The Child - A Typographic Video
content:
Now, this video may be 8(?) years old, but I’ve never seen it before and I’m betting, neither have you. Jimmy told me about it. For type-afficionados, it’s a must-see, I reckon.

[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3bAr\_f3FMvw](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120074337/http:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=3bAr_f3FMvw "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3bAr\_f3FMvw")

See screenshot here.  
 [http://www.manic.com.sg/blog/archives/000525.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120074337/http:/www.manic.com.sg/blog/archives/000525.php "http://www.manic.com.sg/blog/archives/000525.php")

Um, hope you guys are not too put off by the amount of sweetie cupcakes on my site at the moment. I seem to be going through many phases.

 [‹ Studying Typography in Higher Education](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120074337/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29108 "Go to previous forum topic") [Clearview kudos ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120074337/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28997 "Go to next forum topic")
author: karenhuang

comments.content:
hey Karen, thanks for the link man.  
I just love typography based motion graphics.

Ive seen it before, but thanks a lot for reminding me, Karen. :)  
A fabulous one.

Dav
Oldie and a goodie. I believe this was in the first Typophile Film Fest.
Ooops, looks like I’m the only one who hasn’t seen it then. :)

Not new for lots of typophiles, but i still like this.  
 [http://media2.mk12.com/v5\_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120074337/http:/media2.mk12.com/v5_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov "http://media2.mk12.com/v5\_quicktime/2003/brazil.mov")
